meanings.definition: To go around an area or building to make sure it is safe or secure.
meanings.sent1: The security guard patrolled the neighborhood to check for any dangers.
meanings.sent2: The police officer patrolled the streets to ensure everyone's safety.
meanings.sent3: The cat patrolled the backyard, making sure no squirrels invaded its territory.
meanings.sent4: The knight patrolled the castle walls like a vigilant guardian.
meanings.sent5: The diligent lifeguard patrolled the pool area, ready to act in case of an emergency.

meanings.definition: To walk or drive around an area to make sure there is no trouble.
meanings.sent1: The park ranger patrolled the forest to prevent any illegal activities.
meanings.sent2: The security team patrolled the event venue to maintain order.
meanings.sent3: The robot patrolled the factory floor, ensuring all machines were working properly.
meanings.sent4: The shepherd patrolled the fields, keeping a watchful eye on the flock.
meanings.sent5: The crossing guard patrolled the school zone, guiding children safely across the street.

meanings.definition: To keep watch over an area by regularly traveling around it.
meanings.sent1: The border patrol agents patrolled the country's borders day and night.
meanings.sent2: The security detail patrolled the perimeter of the building to deter intruders.
meanings.sent3: The bee patrolled the garden, collecting nectar from flowers.
meanings.sent4: The lighthouse keeper patrolled the coast, guiding ships away from danger.
meanings.sent5: The neighborhood watch group patrolled the streets, looking out for any suspicious activity.
